data.title: Exclude Definition From TS Reference Code Lens References List
data.body:
For the code:

```ts
class Foo {}

new Foo()
```

The reference code lens currently shows:

![screen shot 2017-01-09 at 11 20 09 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/21779689/97c74c4c-d65d-11e6-9e51-c4f6b5744213.png)


This is consistent with what we do for `file all references`, but a little odd since the inline code lens shows one reference while the peek lists two references (one for the `new` and one for the class definition itself). I think we should exclude the definition of the symbol itself from the shown references in the code lens. I'll also make sure this is what VS does.

data.title: Support filtering search by folder with './' syntax
data.body: 'files to include' maps the input 'foo' to globs like `foo/**`, `**/foo`, so it includes anything under the folder foo, or files named foo anywhere in the workspace. It would be helpful to have syntax like `./foo` to limit this to folders from the root, especially for 'Find in folder' from the explorer. Related to #18123.

data.title: PHP syntax coloring lost after encountering '?>' in comments
Background terminal scroll bars are not synced when the foreground terminal is resized
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (12af9ea6effefeaeecde2107c960ae5222703864, 2017-01-09T07:18:17.300Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.8.0-30-generic
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|lorem-ipsum|Tyriar|1.0.0|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.1.0|
|theme-glacier|Tyriar|0.0.10|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.3.0|

|dark-plus-material|vangware|0.1.4|

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open 2 terminals
2. Increase vertical size of terminal
3. Switch to other terminal, the viewport's scroll bar will be the size it was before the resize

Notice the viewport is at the bottom but the scroll bar is in the middle:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/21777826/7ad9515a-d655-11e6-9a8e-10c9d99dc5b7.png)

data.title: Toggle word wrap character insertion bug on Mac
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open either Find or Extensions in the sidebar, and focus a text field
2. Type `Option-Z` to toggle word wrap
3. Word wrap is toggled, but `Î©` is also inserted into the text field
4. I think it should do one or the other, but not both

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/176815/21777777/41a16ada-d655-11e6-9bef-c6c370413b8c.png)

Note that the default keyboard shortcut is:

```json
{
  "key": "alt+z",
  "command": "editor.action.toggleWordWrap",
  "when": "editorTextFocus"
}
```

So this seems like a bug with the `when` condition of `editorTextFocus`, possibly?

data.title: Search panel results are hard to visually skim
data.body:
- **VSCode Version:** 1.8.1
- **OS Version:** macOS Sierra 10.12.2

## Steps to Reproduce:

1. `Command-Shift-F` and search for something
2. Observe that the filename headers and search results are not easily visually separated

## Code

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/176815/21776302/b56b90d2-d64e-11e6-80df-ab515b0f0f0c.png)

## Sublime

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/176815/21776313/c0b8c95a-d64e-11e6-93c4-f50791977056.png)

## Description

In Sublime there is some spacing between the the search result groups, and the filenames have a different color. This makes it a lot easier for me to skim results. It'd be nice to have something similar in Code.

data.title: workbench.action.focusNextGroup spawns unwanted split view editor when in the right-most editor group
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Professional

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have one or many editors open in one or many groups.
2. Navigate to the right most editor and group.
3. Trigger the workbench.action.focusNextGroup command (i.e. via keybinding - in my example .gif I've bound to Alt+L)

Result: An unwanted(?) split view editor is created as a copy of the right most editor

![issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6669336/21774863/dd0c89ba-d68b-11e6-9a4d-5659ac88e803.gif)

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1 (Stable)
- OS Version: Win 10 Home

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write SCSS for numerous hours
2. Stare at the error log while shifting your eyebrows up.

This tends to happen after 3 to 4 hours of work, whole editor slows down too. Restarting the editor fixes the problem for about an hour.

![strng](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9406520/21774605/acb067d6-d69b-11e6-9a19-51791ecffcb2.PNG)

data.title: Feature request: Make "Go to Bracket" work with selections

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.8.1 (1.8.1)
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.4 (15E65)

With some code like this:

```
{
   blah
}
```

1. Move the cursor after the closing brace.
1. Hit <kbd>cmd</kbd>+<kbd>shift</kbd>+<kbd>\\</kbd> to bounce to the matching open brace.
1. Now _select_ the closing brace.
1. Hitting <kbd>cmd</kbd>+<kbd>shift</kbd>+<kbd>\\</kbd> does nothing.

It should select the braces and everything in between them. I use this in vim (with `v%`) all the time to copy/paste code blocks.

data.title: Test new theme matching and new tokens format
data.body:
- [x] @jrieken 
- [x] @chrmarti 

Cmplexity: 4

Plan item: #18317

The changes are heavily covered through unit tests, but there are some integration things that might not work, so please check:
 - create or change a grammar to emit a scope name that contains `<` or `>` or `&`. Please check that these strings do not make it into the editor HTML rendering and also not into the `Developer: Inspect TM Scopes` widget
 - change an editor contribution (in code) to add an inline decoration class name (e.g. link contribution) that contains `<` or `>` or `&`. Please check that these strings do not make it into the editor HTML rendering.
 - check that changing a color theme to `X` produces the same colorization as loading the workbench fresh with the theme `X` (i.e. caches are correctly cleared)
 - open some different files in our most popular languages and in some of the most popular themes. Please compare with the previous stable version, and if you spot differences validate those differences are OK via the `Developer: Inspect TM Scopes` widget

data.title: New theme matching and new tokens format
data.body:
Adopt new theme matching support available in vscode-textmate.

- [x] merge PR with the actual work: #17933

DONE:
- [x] Common
  - [x] adopt new tokens representation in model & co.
  - [x] remove paranoia check in `ViewLineToken`
  - [x] remove `model.getMode()` and `model.getModeId()`
  - [x] rename `LanguageIdentifier.sid` and `LanguageIdentifier.iid`
  - [x] remove `token` class name from every token
- [x] Standalone editor
  - [x] generate new tokens format in monarch and manual tokenizers
  - [x] align standalone languages tokenizers to generate classic style tokens
  - [x] clean up standalone tokens css rules and move them to JS
  - [x] match tokens using theme rules in JS for monarch and manual tokenizers
  - [x] expose new tokenization API in standalone editor
  - [x] adopt standalone languages tests for tokenization
  - [x] validate new tokenization using tokenization.html standalone test
  - [x] allow for theme switching in `standaloneColorService`
  - [x] allow for theme customization in standalone editor
  - ~~check editor with bootstrap css~~ (created follow up task)
  - [x] add inspect tokens command
- [x] adopt new `vscode-textmate`
  - [x] publish `vscode-textmate`
  - [x] get theme information to `vscode-textmate`
  - [x] reimplement theme integration tests
  - [x] allow for theme switching
  - [x] handle encountered languages while tokenizing
  - [x] remove `dom` layer breaker from `TMSyntax.ts`
  - [x] add inspect tokens command

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Generate c_cpp_properties.json and add include path of current workspace.
2. Symbol information is not generated.
3. I think the problem is: ~/.vscode/extensions/ms-vscode.cpptools-0.9.3/bin/Microsoft.VSCode.CPP.Extension.linux is 64-bit binary - no 32-bit binary provided.

data.title: Execute tasks in terminal instead of output panel
data.body:
Currently tasks are executed using its own process runner infrastructure displaying the output in the output panel. This has various limitations:

- no support for ANSI control characters
- no support for input
- no support for encodings

Using the terminal instead would allow to overcome these problems.

data.title: Decouple build from task execution
data.body: Currently build is tightly coupled to task execution via the Run Build task command. We should decouple this and support that extensions can participate in build, rebuild All and clean. In addition a build should be able to consist out of more than one command or task
